name: src/actions/actions.js
fetchAllData
description: Omits the 'ALL_DATA_REQUESTED' action with the given year and month parameter

unknown.tagValue: {object} - with an action type and poosibly a payload.

params.name: year
params.description:
the year what was extracted from a user action.
If undefined, then the actual year, or month will be applied to the saga.

params.name: month
params.description:
the month what was extracted from a user action.
If undefined, then the actual year, or month will be applied to the saga.

return.description: with an action type and poosibly a payload.

name: setUserData
description: Omits the 'SET_USERDATA_REQUESTED' action with the given office and startTime parameter

unknown.tagValue: {object} - with an action type and poosibly a payload.

params.name: office
params.description: The shorthand of the office, what needs to be changed

params.name: startTime
params.description: the new default start time, which was provided by the user

return.description: with an action type and poosibly a payload.

name: updateRowTime
description:
Omits the 'UPDATE_ROW_TIME_REQUESTED' action with the given payload
This action will fire when the user modifies the day row's workstart or workend time.

unknown.tagValue: {object} - with an action type and poosibly a payload.

params.name: payload
params.description: the data needed for updating the row

params.name: payload.type
params.description: type of the updated time, enum: 'workStart', 'workEnd'

params.name: payload.id
params.description: the row's id, possibly the number of th given day

params.name: payload.day
params.description: the day's date in YYYY.MM.DD format

params.name: payload.minute
params.description: the new time in minutes

return.description: with an action type and poosibly a payload.

name: updateRowDeviationType
description:
Omits the 'UPDATE_ROW_DEVIATION_TYPE_REQUESTED' action with the given payload.
This action will fire when the user modifies the day row's deviation column
 (dayoff, sick leave etc.)

unknown.tagValue: {object} - with an action type and poosibly a payload.

params.name: payload
params.description: the data needed for updating the actual year

params.name: payload.id
params.description: the day's serial number

params.name: payload.deviationType
params.description: the type of deviation (sick leave, dayOff etc.)

return.description: with an action type and poosibly a payload.

name: updateUserStatistic
description:
Omits the 'UPDATE_USER_STATISTIC_REQUESTED' action with the given payload.
This action will fire when the user modifies the day row's workstart or workend time.

unknown.tagValue: {object} - with an action type and poosibly a payload.

params.name: payload
params.description: the data needed for updating the actual year

params.name: payload.stepDifference
params.description:
the amount of time we have to add or substract
from the sum of worked hours, deviationTime and summary

return.description: with an action type and poosibly a payload.

name: yearSelected
description: Omits the 'YEAR_SELECT_REQUESTED' action with the given payload

unknown.tagValue: {object} - with an action type and poosibly a payload.

params.name: payload
params.description: the data needed for updating the actual year

params.name: payload.year
params.description:
if the user clicked to another year button,
then this action will send the new year forward to the saga, and reducer

return.description: with an action type and poosibly a payload.

name: monthSelected
description: Omits the 'MONTH_SELECT_REQUESTED' action with the given payload

unknown.tagValue: {object} - with an action type and poosibly a payload.

params.name: payload
params.description: the data needed for updating the actual month

params.name: payload.month
params.description:
if the user clicked to another month button,
then this action will send the new year forward to the saga, and reducer

return.description: with an action type and poosibly a payload.

name: src/components/Calendar/Calendar.jsx
Calendar
description:
Calendar is responsible to list the available years, months, and handle the user's choice, when one of them is selected.
    **Children**:
  • `YearSelector`
  • `MonthSelector`
  • `PrintSheet`

unknown.tagValue: {function} fetchAllData - this will initiate the ALL_DATA_REQUESTED redux action
{function} yearSelected - this will initiate the YEAR_SELECT_REQUESTED redux action
{function} monthSelected - this will initiate the MONTH_SELECT_REQUESTED redux action

{number} selectedYear - loads through redux state.
Initially it will be the actual year but it can be modified by clicking on the corresponding year

{number} selectedMonth - loads through redux state.
Initially it will be the actual month
but it can be modified by clicking on the corresponding month

{number[]} yearList - static array
which contains the year before the actual year,
the actual year, and the year after it

{string[]} monthList - static array
which contains the actual months of the local year

name: state
description: local state of the component

name: componentDidMount
description: on mount, it will save the selectedYear, and selectedMonth from props to the local state

name: handleClick
description: It handles the clicks on the year and month selectors

params.name: index
params.description:
accepts the selected year's or month's index from the click event
and set it to the state

params.name: type
params.description:
give information about whether the index
came from the YearSelector or from the MonthSelector

return.description:
it updates the local state directly, and sends out actions.
No need for return value

name: src/components/Calendar/components/MonthSelector/MonthSelector.jsx
MonthSelector
description: renders the months based on `Monthlist` prop

params.name: SelectedYear
params.description: get the chosen year from `Calendar` state

params.name: selectedMonth
params.description: get the chosen month from `Calendar` state

params.name: monthList
params.description: it renders the list based on monthList

params.name: handleClick
params.description: responsible for handling the clicks on year, month * buttons

name: src/components/Calendar/components/MonthSelector/MonthSelector.util.js
src/components/Calendar/components/PrintSheet/PrintSheet.jsx
PrintSheet
description:
renders the Print button.
Its basically a form with an action pointing to the print endpoint.
It generates the actually selected month's data via pdf

params.name: selectedYear
params.description:
the component needs
the actual year and month to start the API request

params.name: actualMonth
params.description:
the component needs
the actual year and month to start the API request

name: src/components/Calendar/components/YearSelector/YearSelector.jsx
YearSelector
description: renders the months based on `yearList` prop

params.name: SelectedYear
params.description: get the chosen year from `Calendar` state

params.name: yearList
params.description:
static array
which contains the year before the actual year,
the actual year, and the year after it

params.name: handleClick
params.description:
received from `Calendar` component,
responsible for handling the clicks on year, month buttons

description: Contains the DisplayTable and EditButton components

{string} office - the user's selected office

{number} defaultStartTime - The user's preferred
default working start time in minutes
{string} firstDay - the first day of the selected period
{string} lastDay - the last day of the selected period
{string} lastDay - the last day of the selected period

{boolean} selectedTimeIsPassed - a very handy boolean which is stored in the reducer
It tells you that whether the selected time (year and month included) is in the past or not.
It is useful for applying the grey color, the lock on the month buttons, clock component etc.

content:
# Profile Timesheet 2.0

Profile timesheet page reworked with ReactJS and Redux.

## npm instructions

* **run application**
  * Due to the development environment, running the app in development mode is not an option. To see the changes, you must run a build after every change. Type `sudo npm run lazy-build`.

* **build application with code verification**
  * If you run `sudo npm run build`, the script will run some additional commands to verify code integrity. 
  * First it will run eslint to check, if there is any problem with the code styling.
  * Then it will run the unit test to see, if any recent change broke the rendering of the components.

* **run watcher**
  * Whenever you want to start working on the project, run `sudo npm run watch` from the server. Then with every save the code will be builded with the changes to `/public/react/timesheet.js`
  * the `timesheet.js` is connected to the `timesheet/dev` twig, so it will update with refresh

* **build documentation**
  * you can generate ESDoc documentation with `npm run docs`, then find it in the react/docs folder
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "profile-timesheet-2.0",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Timesheet reworked with react",
  "main": "index.jsx",
  "directories": {
    "test": "test"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "pre-build": "npm run lint:fix && npm run test",
    "watch": "watch 'sudo npm run build' src",
    "start": "webpack-dev-server --config webpack.dev.js",
    "build": "npm run pre-build && webpack --config webpack.prod.js",
    "lazy-build": "webpack --config webpack.prod.js",
    "test": "jest . --config ./jest.config.js",
    "lint": "eslint './src/**/*.js' './src/**/*.jsx'",
    "lint:fix": "eslint --fix './src/**/*.js' './src/**/*.jsx'",
    "docs": "./node_modules/.bin/esdoc"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "react",
    "timesheet"
  ],
  "browserslist": [
    ">1%",
    "last 1 version",
    "Firefox ESR",
    "not dead"
  ],
  "author": "lantos14",
  "license": "ISC",
  "dependencies": {
    "@emotion/core": "^10.0.10",
    "@emotion/styled": "^10.0.11",
    "clean-webpack-plugin": "^2.0.1",
    "dotenv-webpack": "^1.7.0",
    "emotion": "^10.0.9",
    "enzyme": "^3.9.0",
    "enzyme-adapter-react-16": "^1.11.2",
    "html-webpack-plugin": "^3.2.0",
    "lodash": "^4.17.11",
    "lodash.clonedeep": "^4.5.0",
    "lodash.isequal": "^4.5.0",
    "moment": "^2.24.0",
    "prop-types": "^15.7.2",
    "react": "^16.8.4",
    "react-dom": "^16.8.4",
    "react-redux": "^6.0.1",
    "redux": "^4.0.1",
    "redux-saga": "^1.0.2",
    "regenerator-runtime": "^0.13.2",
    "webpack": "^4.29.6",
    "webpack-merge": "^4.2.1"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/cli": "^7.2.3",
    "@babel/core": "^7.4.0",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties": "^7.4.0",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.4.2",
    "@babel/preset-react": "^7.0.0",
    "babel-eslint": "^10.0.1",
    "babel-loader": "^8.0.5",
    "check-prop-types": "^1.1.2",
    "css-loader": "^2.1.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-jsx-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-react-plugin": "^1.0.1",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^5.15.3",
    "eslint-config-airbnb": "^17.1.0",
    "eslint-plugin-emotion": "^10.0.7",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.16.0",
    "eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y": "^6.2.1",
    "eslint-plugin-react": "^7.12.4",
    "eslint-watch": "^5.0.1",
    "identity-obj-proxy": "^3.0.0",
    "jest": "^24.5.0",
    "node-sass": "^4.12.0",
    "react-hot-loader": "^4.8.0",
    "react-test-renderer": "^16.8.4",
    "redux-immutable-state-invariant": "^2.1.0",
    "redux-mock-store": "^1.5.3",
    "sass-loader": "^7.1.0",
    "style-loader": "^0.23.1",
    "watch": "^1.0.2",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.3.0",
    "webpack-dev-server": "^3.2.1"
  }
